Updated 4e789b9459ea3a5724cb30cccdaeb0d801f56e15 -> 6249e64acdcd865c44c74d311a079094f866fb75 ([pr18922.01](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr18922.01) -> [pr18922.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr18922.02), [diff](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/compare/pr18922.01..pr18922.02)):

- reworked following @MarcoFalke's ideas and suggestions

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #18927 (Pass bilingual_str argument to AbortNode() by hebasto)
* #18918 (wallet: Move salvagewallet into wallettool by achow101)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

Updated 6249e64acdcd865c44c74d311a079094f866fb75 -> 3ddfa414787e017d9760b2ac55517986673a4b1c ([pr18922.02](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr18922.02) -> [pr18922.03](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr18922.03), [diff](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/compare/pr18922.02..pr18922.03)):

- addressed @MarcoFalke's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18922#discussion_r422521418):
> Please keep the explicit overload for std::string, if you want you can extend it with a comment why it exists.
>
> Also, I like the idea of deriving the return type from the unary operator

> Didn't know that `auto` return type is possible in C++11, but it seems to compile so why not man_shrugging

That's interesting, I thought so too.
But apparently IIUC C++11 supports auto return type, but requires you to put a trailing return type (`-> return_type`) from C++14 you can also skip that and the return type will be deduced.

Updated 3ddfa414787e017d9760b2ac55517986673a4b1c -> 48710740c6f1cfa37c20545d0d6179d5de4bae6e ([pr18922.03](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr18922.03) -> [pr18922.04](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr18922.04), [diff](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/compare/pr18922.03..pr18922.04)):

- addressed @MarcoFalke's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18922#discussion_r422644375)

Updated 48710740c6f1cfa37c20545d0d6179d5de4bae6e -> da16f95c3fecf4ee1e9a1dc4333b0b92cd981afd ([pr18922.04](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr18922.04) -> [pr18922.05](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/commits/pr18922.05), [diff](https://github.com/hebasto/bitcoin/compare/pr18922.04..pr18922.05)):

- addressed @MarcoFalke's [comment](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18922#discussion_r422654602):
> Why is this one needed? (Sorry I missed it in my last review comment)

---

The current implementation of the `Join()` allows do not use `OpOriginal` and `OpTranslated` unary operators at all.
Is it worth to drop them?

>  Is it worth to drop them?

Up to you. I am happy to review either approach, as long as this is done in a new commit.
Added commit which removes `OpOriginal()` and `OpTranslated()` unary operators.

vladiation lol :joy: 

Looks good to me. Nice cleanup with the `*Op` functions.

ACK 78be8d97d3d750fcfbbe509a72639b7b30b7bd18

To have an idea of progress, I would like to know whether an end to this in in sight. Is `InitWarning` the last step? Or are there more functions after this that need to be converted to `bilingual_str`?

Have vladidated the code.

utACK 78be8d97d3d750fcfbbe509a72639b7b30b7bd18
I think the last ones are AbortNode and the gui/rpc warnings https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/16218#issuecomment-626320627

@jonasschnelli Ready for merge?!
I think it would be safer to not allow this and force the caller to go through `Untranslated`

diff_hunk:
@@ -31,9 +31,10 @@ NODISCARD inline std::string TrimString(const std::string& str, const std::strin
  * @param unary_op   Apply this operator to each item in the list
  */
 template <typename T, typename UnaryOp>
-std::string Join(const std::vector<T>& list, const std::string& separator, UnaryOp unary_op)
+auto Join(const std::vector<T>& list, const std::string& separator, UnaryOp unary_op)
body:
```suggestion
auto Join(const std::vector<T>& list, const U& separator, UnaryOp unary_op)
```

I think this requirement can be lifted (here and below)
[Updated](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18922#issuecomment-626197278).
[Updated](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18922#issuecomment-626197278).

diff_hunk:
@@ -31,9 +31,10 @@ NODISCARD inline std::string TrimString(const std::string& str, const std::strin
  * @param unary_op   Apply this operator to each item in the list
  */
 template <typename T, typename UnaryOp>
-std::string Join(const std::vector<T>& list, const std::string& separator, UnaryOp unary_op)
+auto Join(const std::vector<T>& list, const std::string& separator, UnaryOp unary_op)
